The ball's landing place and running lines are indicated through a red marker and yellow lines, respectively. The camera moves and zooms automatically to focus on the action.

Like the console version, the GBA title has a trading card feature. Cards are gained by winning games in many of the modes and can be traded with another player via link cable.

sample_screenshots.caption: The other teams while getting the ball
Quick match mode does not allow you to freely choose a match.
The line connects the active player with the place where the ball lies.

title: All-Star Baseball 2003

description:
High Heat Major League Baseball 2002 marks the first appearance of 3DO's baseball series on a handheld platform. It is also the first MLB-licensed baseball game released for the Game Boy Advance.

Available game modes include Exhibition, Season (16, 81 or 162 games), Playoffs, Home Run Derby and Practice. Season progress is saved to battery-backed RAM. Automatic fielding can be toggled and game length can be set from 1 to 9 innings.

Batting and pitching are done from a view behind the batter. Pitchers can either throw a fastball or select from a variety of special throws on a pitching cursor. Which pitches are available depends on the athlete's skill set. Batting works without aiming and simply requires correct timing when swinging or bunting. Fielding is done on an isometric view of the field. Advanced playing techniques like picking off players, stealing bases, hit-and-runs or beaning are not possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can also choose where you'll throw it.

title: High Heat Major League Baseball 2002

description:
High Heat Major League Baseball 2003 is based closely on the previous year's version, with all the same game modes and options, some changes in graphics and some other additions.

All previous game modes return: Exhibition, Season (16, 81 or 162 games), Playoffs, Home Run Derby and Practice. Season progress is again saved to battery-backed RAM. Multiplayer has been added with two-player matchups via link cable. Teams, players and stats have been updated for the new MLB season.

Gameplay is also largely unchanged. Batting and pitching are again done from a view behind the batter, but with the batter now rendered in real-time via polygons. The pitching interface via the pitching cursor is unchanged, as are the isometric field graphics. Some advanced playing techniques have been added: it is now possible to steal bases and throw bean balls.
title: High Heat Major League Baseball 2003

description:
Electronic Arts' long-running FIFA soccer series makes its debut on the Game Boy Advance with FIFA Soccer 2003. It offers a selection of teams and modes from the concurrent console version, with simpler controls and traditional two-dimensional graphics.

The game includes 14 leagues (the same as in the console version minus the Brazilian league), including English Premier League, German Bundesliga, Spanish Primera División, Italian Serie A and North American Major League Soccer. In addition, there are 16 teams from the rest of the world (down from 40 in the console version) and 40 international teams. There is a license for real player names, with leagues and rosters based on the 2002-2003 season.

The teams can be used in friendly matches, two-player games via link cable and a number of competitions. These include league play for all of the included leagues, Club Championship (a league of the top 18 European clubs), EFA Trophy (akin to the real-world UEFA Cup, but without license) and European Champions Cup (akin to real-world UEFA Champions League, but without license). Competition progress is stored to battery-backed RAM, with two slots available.

Gameplay is seen from an angled overhead view parallel to the sidelines. Controls allow for lobs, kicks and passes on the offensive, and conservative and hard tackles on defense, with a sprint toggle also available. Selectable options include various skill levels (separately for team and goalkeeper), extra time (with Golden Goal option), as well as weather and wind conditions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Need to select another team for a friendly match

title: FIFA Soccer 2003

description:
FIFA Soccer 2004 marks the second appearance of the soccer series on the Game Boy Advance. It is very similar to its immediate predecessor, with many of the same teams, modes and options, but also some new additions.

The number of included leagues has been increased to 16, with the Dutch and Portuguese leagues added. The number of teams from the rest of the world has increased to 24, while the number of international teams has decreased to 37.

Game modes still include friendlies, two-player link cable play, and several competitions. There is league play for all included leagues, the returning EFA Trophy and European Champions Cup (UEFA Cup and UEFA Champions League without license, respectively) and three new additions: Americas Club Championship (pitting North, Central and South American clubs against each other), and International Cup (akin to the real-life World Cup) and a Ladder Tournament. The three new competitions must be unlocked however by connecting to the the GameCube version of the game.

Actual gameplay has changed ony little: the same overhead, two-way scrolling perspective is used as are the same controls.

sample_screenshots.caption: Corner kick; the gauge in the upper right corner is used to set whether with give the ball the intended direction.

title: FIFA Soccer 2004

description:
FIFA Soccer 2005 is the third appearance of the soccer franchise on the Game Boy Advance. It comes with many changes compared to its predecessor, with new modes, more teams, new control options and a new graphics engine.

All included leagues from the predecessor return, with several additions: Brazil and Mexico, plus lower-tier leagues from England, Germany, France, Italy and Spain. There are 12 "rest of the world" teams as well as 39 international teams.

Returning game modes are friendlies, link cable multiplayer, league play, and several tournaments: Americas Club Championship, International Cup and Ladder Tournament. Newly added competitions are the national cups of 16 of the included leagues. Making its first appearance on the GBA (after having been part of the console versions since FIFA 2004) is the career mode: in this mode, players take control of a single club for up to five seasons, taking the club to national and international heights. Each season has its own goals that must be met. Meeting certain conditions in games played awards manager prestige points, which result in a star rating which will improve the squad's performance.

An exclusive feature not seen in the console versions are the challenges. There are comeback challenges and rout challenges, each presenting a certain situation from a real game, asking the player to recreate or improve upon the real results. Playing through all pre-set challenges unlocks the custom challenge editor, which allows the player to create any situation.

The game employs a new 3D graphics engine that allows for variable camera perspectives. During normal gameplay, an overhead view similar to those of the previous games is maintained, but there is a choice of three different zoom levels. Penalties, corner kicks and instant replays place the camera in appropriate spots.

Controls have become more complex with the addition of the left shoulder button as a modifier, which allows for through ball and 1-2 pass plays on offense and last man back and goalkeeper charges on defense.
title: FIFA Soccer 2005

description:
Punch King is a 3rd-person, cartoonish boxing game very similar to Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!!.

Fights lasts three rounds, and there's a three knockdown rule in effect. Each opponent has their own tells and patterns which the player needs to memorize. They can be defeated by dodging, ducking and punching at the right times.
title: Punch King

description:
This double pack is a compilation of two Yu-Gi-Oh! games, previously released individually for the GBA:

  • Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Sacred Cards
  • Yu-Gi-Oh!: Reshef of Destruction
title: Yu-Gi-Oh!: Double Pack

description:
The Limited Edition of The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap, also known as the Limited Edition Adventure Set was released worldwide, limited to 300 pieces and was originally intended as a prize in a competition and sold in the Club Nintendo online shop for a brief time.

  • The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap cartridge for the Gameboy Advance
  • Certificate of authenticity
  • Gold Zelda themed Nintendo Gameboy Advance SP system plus GBA adapter
  • Minish Cap T-shirt
  • Triforce woolly hat
title: The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap (Limited Edition)

description:
The Fairly OddParents!: Enter the Cleft is a 2D platformer. It is the very first game based off of The Fairly Oddparents! cartoon series.

The plot of the game involves Timmy Turner, the show's hero, wishing to meet his favourite comic book character, the Crimson Chin. Cosmo & Wanda, the titular fairy godparents wish him inside of an issue and the game begins.

The game is a simple 2D platformer, in which Timmy is the only playable character. Timmy, as his alter-ego Cleft the Boy-Chin Wonder, must travel through the various stages to rescue the Chin. There are five worlds, each with four levels, for a total of twenty locations to play through.
title: The Fairly OddParents!: Enter the Cleft

description:
The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy is a game based after the Cartoon Network series of the same name. Grim's chest was tampered with and Mojo Balls were released into the universe. These Mojo Balls infect everyone they touch with supernatural rage. So Grim, Billy and Mandy have to go out and retrieve them all to prevent the universe to fall into eternal chaos.

The game's Story mode is a side-scrolling platformer/brawler, which alternates between small platforming sections and stopping to have the player battle a certain amount of enemies, all of which have to be defeated before the level can move on. To accomplish this the player has kick and punch attacks as well as an air attack and a special attack which can be launched once the power bar is full. It is filled by defeating enemies. There is also a double jump and a butt bounce action, which help to get through the platforming sections.

At the end of each character's story is a boss, whose defeat awards the player with one Mojo Ball. The Mojo Balls are needed to unlock the extra characters. Initially only Billy is available, then Mandy, and last Grim. To unlock Mandy Billy's Story must be completed and a certain amount of Mojo Balls collected. Most of the Mojo Balls come from Mission mode, which plays essentially the same, but in very short levels, many of which have time limits and play like mini-games.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lesson 4. Don't feel like reading it.
Choose your character. Mandy and Grim are locked.

title: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy

description:
Ice Nine is a first person shooter where player assumes a role of newly-enlisted CIA operative. The game starts at Langley with a series of training missions: target practice and live exercise with marker pellets instead of real bullets, where you need to mark your fellow operatives in a real urban area. However that training ends on a sour note as you learn that one of your colleagues could possibly be a mole that tries to leak and sell a deadly computer virus called Ice Nine. Since there's no hard proof it becomes your new mission to infiltrate CIA and find it - not without help from your chief.

The game is using 3D-engine similar to Doom or Dark Forces - it can display some simple texture mapped 3D architecture, has variable level height, ladders, elevators, but the characters are sprite-based and there's no free look. Many objects on levels could be destroyed or at least damaged. The game is majorly run'n'gun exercise where doors are opened automatically to not slow down the action and most of the goals include finding keys or objects and eliminating all of the opposition, however in several missions the CIA agent must avoid security cameras and use night vision to move in the dark.

There are 18 missions, but some of the locations are reused throughout the game. Ice Nine arsenal offers a standard FPS set that has everything from a handgun to rocket launcher, also there's a sniper rifle that can be used with a zoom feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mission Complete. Missing enemies or shooting civilians lowers our score.
Mission 3: "Tag" the people wearing red trousers (they are enemies)
The first couple of missions are tutorials to help players get used to the controls.

title: Ice Nine

description: Monopoly is a GBA conversion of the classic board game of the same name. The game can be played with a computer player or another player. The game has 4 different modes to choose from including timed mode, custom mode, timed limit mode (playing the game with a time limit), and standard mode.
title: Monopoly

description: Spider-Man 2 is a 2D side-scrolling platform game based on the Spider-Man 2 film. It expands on the plot of the film, adding characters like Black Cat, Mysterio and the Rhino, while maintaining the core gameplay of the previous 2002 game Spider-Man by the same developer. The game brings back the mechanic of taking pictures in-game by pressing the Select button in certain areas.

sample_screenshots.caption: We can spend the points on skills and upgrades.
The Story is told through these pre-rendered cutscenes.
When an attack is executed, players see comic-book style exclamations.
Sometimes the blend of 2D and 3D looks strange, like when Spider-Man is using his web here.

title: Spider-Man 2

description:
This compilation features the following two games:

  • Dreamworks Madagascar: Operation Penguin
  • Shrek 2
title: 2-In-1 Fun Pack: Dreamworks Madagascar: Operation Penguin / Dreamworks Shrek 2

description:
Hardcore Pinball contains four different tables that span over multiple screens with vertical scrolling and have their own themes: Soccer, RoboMech, Retro, and Station.

Starting a game with four balls and using the shoulder buttons to control the flippers, you must uncover the secrets of each table to reach the highest possible score. Each table comes with its own set of specific music and sound effects and has its own high score list.
title: Hardcore Pinball

description:
This compilation features the following two games:

  • Hugo: Bukkazoom!
  • Hugo: The Evil Mirror
title: Hugo 2in1: Bukkazoom! / The Evil Mirror

description: Cabbage Patch Kids: The Patch Puppy Rescue is a platform game for the Game Boy Advance. You begin the game by selecting one of several Kids to control, each with their own name and appearance. The goal is to reach the end of several sets of platforming levels & talk to the friend or puppy at the end. The gameplay is simple and there is no way to die or take damage, though there are occasional enemies who will knock you back if you touch them. There are also three minigames to play through in-between stages. After beating all the stages, you can revisit each level to collect all the gems and try for a 100% file.
title: Cabbage Patch Kids: The Patch Puppy Rescue

alternate_titles.title: La Vallée du Petit Dinosaure: Aventures vers l'Inconnu

description: The Land Before Time: Into the Mysterious Beyond is an action platforming game where the player takes control of a group of dinosaur friends as they search for their missing friend Chomper, a young Tyrannosaurus Rex who got lost in the Mysterious Beyond. The game features platforming levels where the player will play as the Apatosaurus Littlefoot, the Pteranodon Petrie, or the Saurolophus Ducky, as well as levels with a top down perspective where they take control of the Triceratops Cera or the Stegosaurus Spike. Each character has a different level type, with Littlefoot's focused on normal platforming, Petrie's on flight, Ducky's on swimming, Cera's on breaking boulders in her path, and Spike on navigating mazes. There are some special levels where all the dinosaurs may ride together on a leaf sled or a raft, and the final level has a greater combat focus as the player controls Littlefoot's grandfather.

sample_screenshots.caption: Press B to knock over a tree

title: The Land Before Time: Into the Mysterious Beyond

description:
This double pack has two of the SpongeBob GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • SpongeBob SquarePants: Revenge of the Flying Dutchman
  • SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Pack: SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge / SpongeBob SquarePants: Revenge of the Flying Dutchman

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Rugrats Go Wild
  • SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge
title: 2 Games in 1: SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge + Rugrats Go Wild

description:
This compilation has three GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Rugrats: I Gotta Go Party
  • SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge
  • Tak and the Power of Juju
title: 3 Games in 1: Tak and the Power of Juju / SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge / Rugrats: I Gotta Go Party

description:
This has four GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Nicktoons: Freeze Frame Frenzy
  • SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge
  • Rocket Power: Zero Gravity Zone
  • Fairly Odd Parents! Shadow Showdown
title: Nickelodeon, Vol. 1 - Rocket Power: Zero Gravity Zone / Nicktoons: Freeze Frame Frenzy / SpongeBob SquarePants: SuperSponge / Fairly Odd Parents! Shadow Showdown

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Hot Wheels: World Race
  • Hot Wheels: Velocity X
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Pack: Hot Wheels: World Race / Hot Wheels: Velocity X

This game is a compilation of:

  • Sonic Pinball Party
  • Sonic Battle
title: 2 Games in 1: Sonic Pinball Party + Sonic Battle

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Scooby Doo
  • Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Pack: Scooby-Doo / Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Scooby-Doo and the Cyber Chase
  • Scooby Doo!: Mystery Mayhem
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Pack: Scooby-Doo and the Cyber Chase / Scooby Doo! Mystery Mayhem

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • LEGO Knights' Kingdom
  • BIONICLE
title: 2 Games in 1: LEGO Knights' Kingdom + Bionicle

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Sonic Advance
  • ChuChu Rocket!
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Pack: Sonic Advance + ChuChu Rocket!

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Sonic Advance
  • Sonic Battle

This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Disney's Brother Bear
  • Disney's The Lion King 1 ½
title: 2 Games in 1: Disney's Brother Bear + Disney's The Lion King

alternate_titles.title: 2 Games in 1: Disneys Bärenbrüder + Disneys Prinzessinnen

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Disney Princess
  • Disney's Brother Bear
title: 2 Games in 1: Disney's Brother Bear + Disney Princess

description:
Wankuru is a falling-block puzzle game that plays similarly to Sega's Baku Baku Animal. Players drop pairs of puzzle blocks, which can be dogs, doghouses, or a mix of the two. The goal is to place long chains of dogs of the same colour, then place a doghouse of the same colour next to them so the whole chain can go home. Like other puzzle games, creating long chain reactions produces a major point reward. Like in the Puyo Puyo series, chain reactions rain garbage blocks down on the opponent's playfield; in this game, the garbage blocks are bones, and any dog eating a bone will refuse to enter a doghouse until they finish.

Similar to the earlier Windows version, there are both single-player and multiplayer modes. The main single-player game is a story mode which features some short visual novel-style scenes in between matches against the CPU. In this version the player is able to customize both their protagonist and their dog. The player can pick and name a female or male protagonist, and can also choose from one of a large number of dog breeds to name and customize. There is also a score attack mode, in which the player tries to get as far as possible through a set of 100 levels while racking up points. There is also a two-player mode which uses the Game Boy Advance's link cable.

sample_screenshots.caption: We can name our character; it includes an English font!
The pause screen lets us choose whether or not to continue.
The story scenes include dialogue with multiple characters.

title: Wanko de Kururin! Wankuru

description: Killer 3D Pool is a pool game that features four games for players: English 8-ball, U.S. 9-ball, U.S. 8-ball, and Killer.
title: Killer 3D Pool

description:
Pikmin 2-e was a game for the Game Boy Advance e-Reader that was exclusive to Japan, it included three different minigames with multiple levels that you could play by scanning the e-Reader cards. There were 60 cards total, with 12 cards in each pack. In order for the game to be played the Game Boy Advance has to be connected to both an e-Reader and a Gamecube with Pikmin 2

The three minigames were: Hikkonuki Pikmin: A tile-based puzzle where Olimar has to pluck all the Pikmin from the ground. Tekuteku Pikmin: You control the Pikmin and must get them to the end of the course. Tsunagete Pikmin: You must swap the tiles to get the Pikmin to the Research Pod.
title: Pikmin 2-e

description: Four themed pinball tables with their own unique goals await players in Pinball Tycoon. Digging for gold in California Gold Rush, striking oil in Black Gold, making it big in Hollywood Mogul, and striking it rich in Golden Chance turn pinball into a chance to be a big time tycoon. The game offers a multiplayer mode where up to four players can compete for the highest score on a table.
title: Pinball Tycoon

description:
In this adaptation of the animated film Kong: King of Atlantis, you play as Jason, Lua, and King Kong himself in a side-scrolling adventure platformer on a quest to stop the evil Queen Reptilla from Atlantis as she tries to use Kong for her own gain.

Players must fight with their fists and special moves to take down the tar monsters and snake men found on the island of Atlantis, all three characters playing in similar levels and similar ways even though two are human and one is a giant ape. With 15 short platforming levels to explore it isn't too long of an experience, with each level having a password in case the player wishes to continue play another time.
title: Kong: King of Atlantis

description:
This game is a compilation of:* Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

  • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2: Battle Nexus
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Double Pack

description: Trollz: Hair Affair! is a minigame compilation based on the animated television series produced by DIC Entertainment Corporation. It features five teenage "trollz", Amethyst, Ruby, Sapphire, Topaz, and Onyx, who manage their day-to-day high school lives with the help of their magic. Each character is tied to a different minigame: Topaz has "Watch the Hair", in which she shrinks down and climbs through her friends' hair to untangle knots while dodging frizzies and Snarf; Sapphire has Smarty Trollz, a memory-matching game; Ruby has Trollz Dance, a rhythm game; Amethyst has Flying Spell, an aerial sidescroller that also involves shooting enemies while managing the skoot's energy; and Onyx has Spell Beadz, a Puzzle Bobble clone. Each minigame also features collectible power-ups, with each one doing something different depending on the game. The gameplay is affected by the difficulty setting chosen at the beginning of the game (easy, medium, or hard).In the story mode, these minigames are played in between short cutscenes.
title: Trollz: Hair Affair!

description:
Power Pro-kun Pocket 4 is a 2002 arcade Baseball simulator developed by Diamond Head and published by Konami for the Game Boy Advance.

The game's main feature is its Success story scenario, "Sunrise Highschool Edition", which follows a boy who is inflicted with a deadly curse after accidentally knocking over a memorial headstone. His friends start vanishing and his Baseball club is set ablaze. If he does not rebuild the club and win the Koshien tournament in three years, even he will be dragged into a vortex of oblivion.

The player must manage the protagonist's weekly routine to train, recruit new teammates, fix the Baseball club and date one out of a few love interests. Failing the story's objectives or losing any late-game matches results in a game over which erases the player's save file. It is possible to reset the game to prevent that, but there are restrictions and penalties for doing so.

Clearing the first scenario 3 times reveals the Inner Success, which is called "RPG-Style Fantasy". It follows a warrior in a fantasy world who must face various monstrous threats while looking for powerups and mystical spheres to build a Baseball Doll for a king. From this installment on, various characters from previous games are adapted into these alternate universes.

As suggested by the title, this mode features turn-based battles and random encounters. Allies can be found around the world and recruited, but will be lost if killed in combat or from other circumstances. The same inventory system from Pawapoke 3 is used to manage powerups for the player character and his custom Baseball Doll. And although the player is under a limit of 200 actions to clear the story with, rushing through the mission can result in various events being lost, including the final boss.

Upon clearing either Success mode, the player can use the resulting character to build a custom team for playing Baseball on the Exhibition mode. Much of the game's replayability comes from attempting to earn the best possible ballplayers with strategy and luck. Matches between two people who own the game and a link cable are supported, and players can also share their characters via long passwords.

sample_screenshots.caption: The souls of the dead erase Hero 4's friends from reality and from everyone's memories!
Finding the magical spheres for the Baseball Doll is the main goal. Some are guarded by powerful bosses.
Clear Sunrise Highschool three times to unlock RPG-style Fantasy.
Up to 6 custom teams can be recorded.

title: Power Pro Kun Pocket 4

description: Jump into the cockpits of the Navy's top planes with Top Gun: Combat Zones. With the F-14, F-18, and F-22 under your control, you must embark on dangerous low-level missions throughout hazardous canyons and across vast cityscapes. Eliminate ground or air targets in Southeast Asia, Gulf States, Arctic Circle, and Miramar Base. The game offers 36 intense missions and a replay mode that lets you review each one through different camera angles.
title: Top Gun: Combat Zones

description: Fantastic 4 is based on the 2005 film of the same name starring Marvel's classic superheroes. It adapts the film in the form of a beat'em up/brawler seen from an isometric perspective. The player controls the Fantastic Four (usually only two, but sometimes all four at the same time) and can switch between them at will, with each of the heroes having different attacks they use to fight minions and boss enemies. The Four also have distinct special abilities that are utilized for slight puzzle elements, with a color-coded prompt usually indicating which hero's power is necessary to overcome an obstacle. Besides Dr. Doom (the main villain of the film), the game includes additional storylines featuring other villains from the comics.
title: Fantastic 4

alternate_titles.title: SpongeBob Schwammkopf und seine Freunde im Fotofieber
SpongeBob SquarePants and Friends in Freeze Frame Frenzy

description:
Nicktoons: Freeze Frame Frenzy is a side-scrolling picture-taking game involving characters from various Nickelodeon cartoons such as The Fairly OddParents, Spongebob Squarepants, Danny Phantom, and Rocket Power.

An unknown antagonist has begun scrambling the different universes of the Nicktoons, characters being flung into each other's worlds as robotic copies try to integrate into their societies during the chaos. Assuming the role of one of the main characters from the represented franchises, players are instructed by Jimmy Neutron to head to the worlds of the Nicktoons and use a specially designed camera to return characters to their home dimensions while also finding and defeating the robot doppelgangers.

Players are able to move their chosen character around a set walking area to avoid hazards and get better angles for their free-moving camera cursor. Taking pictures of objects in the environment can reveal characters, and many characters require repeated snapshots to perform actions or return to their home dimension. Each level has a score threshold that needs to be beaten by taking pictures of characters and interesting sights, with many smaller side objectives like photographing a specific interaction between characters providing point bonuses if they're completed. Boss fights also cap off each world where players must survive attacks and snap three good shots of the robot duplicates.
title: Nicktoons: Freeze Frame Frenzy

description:
Based on the film of the same name, The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause sees players controlling Scott Calvin in a platforming game that follows the movies events. Beginning as him firmly in his role as Santa Claus, early levels are devoted to exploring icy levels at the North Pole, collecting cookies and milk while avoiding hazards like spiky ice and enemies. Players only need to reach the end of the levels to complete them, the game capping off most of its chapters with minigames like elves navigating a haywire workshop to build a scooter or playing as Santa flying his sleigh to deliver coal and presents to the appropriate households.

Villain Jack Frost aims to sabotage Santa's Christmas activities so he can steal the mantle of the legendary holiday figure for himself, leading to Scott Calvin having to navigate a few levels without his Christmas powers. Normally Santa can glide with his coat and attack with a jack-in-the-box, but Scott relies only on thrown snowballs to repel baddies and the double jump both he and Santa share for level navigation. Some levels will change away from the lax pace of free level exploration to add automatically scrolling screens to pressure players into fast movement.
title: The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause

description: Flappy Bird is a homebrew version of Flappy Bird for the Game Boy Advance. The player plays as Bird. By flying over pipes the player gets points. If the bird falls to the ground or touches something, the game is over.
title: Flappy Bird

description: A fashion simulation game in which your goal is to collect over 300 items of clothing and accessories, hairstyles, makeup, etc in order to become the most fashionable student at your school.
title: Angel Collection: Mezase! Gakuen no Fashion Leader

description:
A fashion simulation game in which your goal is to become a model for the Pichi Lemon magazine. Pichi Lemon was a real girls' magazine that was published from 1986 until 2015. This game includes clothes and accessories that were featured in the magazine itself, as well as tie-in items from real brands such as PENTY'S.

You collect clothes, accessories, hairstyles, makeup and different patterns for your clothes by working part-time at clothing stores and gaining fashion sense. The more your sense goes up, the more stores you can shop at, and the number of items you can purchase increases. Purchasing items requires "points", which you also earn from working part-time.

There are over 300 items to collect in the game.
title: Angel Collection 2: Pichimo ni Narō

description: Players enter the casino with $2000 and try to turn it into a fortune by gambling. The casino lets the player gamble at craps, roulette, blackjack, video poker, and two slot machines The slot machines are the multiple line Halloween Spooky and the single line Wild West. The four video poker machines are Jacks or Better, Deuces Wild, Jokers Wild, and 10's or Better.
title: Golden Nugget Casino

description:
This double pack has two GBA games combined on one cartridge:

  • Golden Nugget Casino
  • Texas Hold 'Em Poker
title: 2 Games in 1 Double Value! Golden Nugget Casino / Texas Hold 'Em Poker

description: Texas Hold 'Em Poker lets players play the card game in both a quick play and a career mode. Quick play lets the player choose to play a quick sit down table game or a single table tournament game. The stakes range from small $5/$10 games up to $80/$160 games. Players can choose to either go heads up or play against up to nine other opponents. The Career Mode lets the player compete in either a sit down game or a single table tournament. Winning a tournament will qualify the player to compete in more tournaments for higher stakes including pot limit and no limit. The goal is to reach the tournament at Vegas and ultimately win the Texas Hold 'Em Poker Championship.

sample_screenshots.caption: Show me the color of your money

title: Texas Hold 'Em Poker

description:
Rocky is a boxing game that was inspired by the first five Rocky movies.

The main mode is called Movie mode which follows Rocky's career from small-time boxer to champ. There are 20 opponents from the movie for Rocky to fight. Beating certain boxers will unlock cutscenes inspired by the movies and is basically the games narrative moments.

In this mode Rocky has to train before each match so his skills can improve. Training increases Rocky's strength, speed, stamina, and defense statistics. Training includes sparring with a padded trainer, hitting the heavy bag, or punching the speed bag. These activities can be done manually or automatically as the player so chooses. When in the ring Rocky can throw left and right punches, do combos, and can dodge punches.

Other modes include Exhibition mode, Knockout mode, and a 2 player Versus Mode. In exhibition mode players can fight any boxer they unlocked from the Movie mode and they also have the option to select the venue, the round length, the number of rounds, and the computer's difficulty level. Knockout mode is unlocked only after Movie mode is completed. It is basically a survival mode in which the player selects a series of fighters against whom to compete for belts in a tournament.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pad training requires you to press the correct button combo when it is shown on the screen.
Rocky I Vs Apollo Creed in the Heavyweight Championship fight
The opponent has been knocked down.

title: Rocky

description: A handheld version of European Super League. However the action is viewed from an isometric perspective and the game only has 12 teams instead of 16.

sample_screenshots.caption: The keeper sets the ball in play again.
A sliding tackle. Missing with a mile though.
It's a goal, as this little cinematic shows.
Very bad defense here. Two players free.

title: European Super League

description:
The escaped convict Brickster has taken the opportunity of his new found freedom to do the nefarious deed of ripping out 15 pages of the Constructopedia, LEGO Island's building blueprint book, and scattered the pages throughout the island. Now it's up to Pepper Roni, a skateboarding pizza delivery boy to find the pages and send Brickster back to jail.

Players control Pepper Roni and go around the island trying to locate the Constructopedia pages. Pepper can give the pages he found to certain characters who in turn will build a structure that will help improve the island. Pepper will also have to partake in various mini-games throughout the game. Also, finding hidden Lego character cards is the games reward for observant exploration of the island.

Although Pepper can't be killed, he will have to deal with the Brickster-Bot enemies by either bumping into them or stunning them with a pizza throw.

sample_screenshots.caption: Informaniac comes to ask for help.
Found a missing construction book page

title: LEGO Island 2: The Brickster's Revenge

description:
Bomberman Jetters: Densetsu no Bomberman is an action role-playing game from the Bomberman series. It is directly based on the Bomberman Jetters anime and its storyline.

The player can take a role of Bomberman or Max to save the Planet Bomber from the Hige Hige Bandits who want to ruin it with an artificial planet called Dark Star. To accomplish their mission Bomberman and Max have to destroy four engines of Dark Star.

There is also available a battle mode and an up to four players head-to-head multi-player mode.
title: Bomberman Jetters: Densetsu no Bomberman

description:
Bomberman Jetters: Game Collection is a collection of minigames and a part of the Bomberman series. It is based on the Bomberman Jetters anime.

4 main sections can be found in the menu: Pinball Game, Battle Mode, Minigame Collection, Gallery.

  • Pinball Game - a typical Bomberman-themed arcade game with an addition of the boss fights.
  • Battle Mode - a traditional up to four players head-to-head single-player or multi-player mode.
  • Minigame Collection - a variety of different minigames similar or directly based on the ones from the Bomberman Land titles.
  • Gallery - a collection of 60 locked pictures that can be unlocked after getting certain achievements in Pinball Game and Minigame Collection.
title: Bomberman Jetters: Game Collection

description: Like the other handheld version of the game Shrek SuperSlam shares the same story, however the fighting is done in 2D.
title: Shrek SuperSlam

description:
Micro Machines is a top-down arcade racing game where the player controls miniature toy vehicles.

There are 2 main single-player modes to race in: Quick Race, Championship. Quick Race has 4 sub-modes: Race, Micro Machines, Time Trial, Bombtag. Championship consists of Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum cups and has 3 sub-modes: Race, Micro Machines, Time Trial. It is possible to select up to 3 computer opponents to compete with.

The world has 8 locations and 16 different tracks with a big variety of power-ups lying around. The player can choose from 8 characters with their own set of vehicles (there are 40 of them in total and they are divided into 5 classes: 4x4, Bike, Boat, Default, Sport).

An up to 4 players multi-player mode is also available in the game.
title: Micro Machines

description:
After numerous conflicts around Earth, peace has finally come, if only temporarily. A race of extraterrestrials, Barm (バーム, from the animated series Tōshō Daimos), escaping their dying home planet, come to the Earth Orbit as refugees. While initially the Earth Federation was willing to accept them into the Space Colonies, the assassination of the diplomatic mission results in the war with the extraterrestrials. Meanwhile, an empire on the Moon declares independence and assaults the Federation, and the Mars Colony goes missing after an attack by an unknown enemy. On Earth, monsters of Dr. Hell (Mazinger Z) start rampaging through again. The only saving grace for the Federation is the 13th Independent Battalion, Londo Bell (from Char's Counterattack). However, none of the members of the team really know who sowed the seeds of war. The battalion bands together to find out.

This is the first game in the Super Robot Wars/Taisen franchise released for the Game Boy Advance. Graphics-wise, the game shares many similarities with the games in the Classic timeline, especially F and F Final. Units in combat do not have battle animations and they are drawn in the "super-deformed" style. In terms of gameplay, the game is a classic tactical RPG with many Japanese robot franchises. Unlike the previous entries in the series, the game introduces a loyalty system, where units that assist other units by way of support attack or defense can increase their damage or defense rate every time they do it. Also, defensive items such as shields now have their own separate HP bar.

Like other SRW games starting from F, F Final and Alpha, players are given the option of choosing their main character and their robot type. Depending on the choice of the type of robot or choices made by the player character mid-game, the story can branch out in different directions. During intermissions, players can customize pilot skills and upgrade their current robot roster.
title: Super Robot Taisen A

description:
Zapper: One Wicked Cricket! is an action game played from a bird-eye perspective. The game starts with the insects Zapper and Zipper fighting over control of the TV remote. At some point the TV antenna breaks and Zapper comes up with the idea to use Zipper as a replacement antenna. While hanging out of the window Zipper is taken away by the bird Maggie, leaving Zapper no other choice then go after Zipper.

In the game, the player takes control of Zapper the cricket and has to collect all eggs in map to open the portal to the next level. Along the way the player has to evade strange enemies like rabbits and slugs. Zapper can also zap (destroy) crates. The game has a story, arcade and multiplayer mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sometimes the eggs, which are to be collected, have legs and walk around the level.
The map from which all levels are accessed. It is possible to visit a level again.
These fields enable Zapper to do one extra strong zap which can destroy metal plates and kill enemies normally unaffected by his electricity.
These rabbits quickly get on your nerves.

title: Zapper: One Wicked Cricket!

sample_screenshots.caption: You can switch to your first person view at the press of a button.
You hunt using an overhead map, with the blue dot representing you.
Be patient and smart, and you might get close enough for a shot...
The game gives you stats on every animal you bag.

alternate_titles.title: ESPN Great Outdoor Games: Bass Tournament

description:
Heidi: The Game is a side scrolling platform game based on the 2005 movie Heidi.

In the game, the player controls the girl Heidi and has to run and jump platforms to reach the end of the level. The player start with three lives which diminish by taking damage from forest creatures like a fox, hedgehog or bird. The player can also collect flowers, 100 flowers earns an extra live.
title: Heidi: The Game

description:
Majesco Kid's Cards is cards game including five different card games. The included games are:

  • Go Fish
  • War!
  • Crazy 8's
  • Old Maid
  • Slap Jack
title: Majesco Kid's Cards

sample_screenshots.caption: Cold Ice Cream - How to play

description:
The Mummy is an 2D action-adventure game for the Game Boy Advance played from a bird-eye perspective that is based on the The Mummy: The Animated Series. The game starts with the O'Connell family traveling to Egypt to investigate strange phenomena happening at a dig near Cairo. There they meet up with Ardeth Bay who suspects Imhotep is behind it.

In the game, the player can freely switch between all members of the family (Alex, Rick and Evy). Each of the members have their own strengths and weaknesses. Rick is strong, while Evy can read hieroglyphs and Alex can pick locks. As the player explores the underground ruins hostile creatures like scorpions and undead have to be fought. The player also needs to find keys to unlock doors. Coins can be collected and used to revive knocked down members at a Ank circles on the floor.

For the PlayStation 2 and Windows, a different and fully 3D game was released.

sample_screenshots.caption: Giant hostile scorpions are infesting the area

title: The Mummy
Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus

alternate_titles.title: Findet Nemo: Das Abenteuer geht weiter

sample_screenshots.caption: Collecting hearts can you recover your health.

title: Disney•Pixar Finding Nemo: The Continuing Adventures

description: Rotris is a variant of Tetris. The basic gameplay is identical. Geometric shapes fall from the top of a playfield to rest on the bottom; fit the pieces together, and the line they form disappears. If the pieces don't form lines and eventually stack up to the top of the playfield, the game is over.
title: Rotris

description: Tetris CA is a variant of Tetris. The basic gameplay is identical. Geometric shapes fall from the top of a playfield to rest on the bottom; fit the pieces together, and the line they form disappears. If the pieces don't form lines and eventually stack up to the top of the playfield, the game is over.
title: Tetris CA

description: Bobble Tris this is a Tetris variant, utilizing graphics borrowed from Taito's Puzzle Bobble series. The basic gameplay is identical. Geometric shapes fall from the top of a playfield to rest on the bottom; fit the pieces together, and the line they form disappears. If the pieces don't form lines and eventually stack up to the top of the playfield, the game is over.
title: Bobble Tris

sample_screenshots.caption: Welcome to the secret enemy control center
That Robot Puppy can distract guards

title: Secret Agent Barbie: Royal Jewels Mission

description:
Disney's Treasure Planet is a 2D action-adventure game for the Game Boy Advance played from a bird-eye perspective that is based on the 2002 movie of the same name. The game follows Jim Hawkins and his search for the legendary treasure of pirate captain Flint.

In the game, the player takes control of Jim and has to navigate him through the different levels. The player has the ability to jump and fight of hostile robots and monsters. Sometimes crates or other objects have to be moved to reaches certain places or items. Items include keys to unlock doors and dynamite to blow up rocks. In some sections of the game the player has to navigate Jim on his solar surf plank and avoid obstacles. The player can also collect coins, 100 coins earns an extra live.

For the PlayStation and PlayStation 2, a different and fully 3D game was released.

sample_screenshots.caption: "RobotCop can see you if you stand in front of it. It will chase you and throw you out if it catches you!"

title: Disney's Treasure Planet

description: Based on scenes and plot from the movie of the same name, Spider-Man finds himself swinging, webbing and crawling across New York city, battling a multitude of organized criminals and superhuman mutants, while saving hapless citizens throughout. At some point he gets enhanced by the Venom symbiote which might prove to be his undoing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Symbiote Spider-Man vs the Mad Bomber

title: Spider-Man 3

alternate_titles.title: Bob l'Éponge et ses Amis : Attaque sur l'Île du Volcan
SpongeBob and Friends: Battle for Volcano Island
SpongeBob und seine Freunde: Schlacht um die Vulkaninsel

sample_screenshots.caption: Danny can become phantom to pass through this block.
You must blow bubbles to clear the toxic ooze.

title: Majesco's Rec Room Challenge: 3 Games in One - Darts / Roll-a-Ball / Shuffle Bowl

description:
Danny Phantom: The Ultimate Enemy is a 2D action game based on the Danny Phantom Nickelodeon cartoon series. In the game Danny must face his evil future self to save Amity Park.

In the game, the player takes control of Danny Phantom and has to fight of ghosts. The player has to switch between regular Danny and his ghost mode. In ghost mode Danny has special abilities like passing through walls and firing projectiles. These abilities take energy witch depletes. This energy can be recharged in regular mode.
title: Danny Phantom: The Ultimate Enemy

description:
Butt-Ugly Martians: B.K.M. Battles is a side-scrolling shoot'em up game based on the cartoon of the same name. The Martian Emperor Bog has grown tired of his inefficient Earth-invaders-turned-Earth-protectors envoys and had dispatched an army of evil aliens to finally take over the Earth. The three Butt-Ugly Martians must stop him.

The player can pick their favorite Martian out of B-Bop A-Luna, 2T Fru-T, or Do-Wah Diddy, each with a different mix of attack, defense, and speed abilities. All of them are in "butt-kicking mode" (B.K.M.), meaning they don their powerful assault suit.

On each level, the player is tasked with destroying aliens and unlocking doors by finding the correct keys to reach the end of the space cavern where a boss enemy will be waiting for them. Various power-ups can be picked up to increase the abilities of the playable characters: extra fire power, extra armor, temporary invincibility, turbo, etc.

Occasionally, the player will be confronted by Stoat Muldoon, an alien hunter and long-time antagonist of the Butt-Ugly Martians, who can be defeated by simply collecting a memory erasing crystal and using it against him. The game contains a total of 28 levels spread over 7 worlds. There are three difficulty levels and progress is saved using a password system.

Butt-Ugly Martians: B.K.M. Battles also features Gamecube connectivity with the game Butt Ugly Martians: Zoom or Doom in which special content can be unlocked by collecting five colored gems in the Game Boy Advance game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 1 complete; note the password at the bottom.

title: Butt-Ugly Martians: B.K.M. Battles

description:
A port of sorts of the Playstation game Pac-Man World 20th Anniversary. Due to the game now appearing on a handheld device some sacrifices were made.

  • The 23 levels of the PlayStation version were reduced to only 12. This removed the factory levels where Pac-Man rescues Pac Jr. and this reduction in levels also causes the majority of the boss fights to be removed too.
  • The Maze Mode and Classic Mode of the PlayStation version are not present here.
  • The story told through FMV cutscenes of the PlayStation version are now just still images with text. Since the FMV's were removed the bonus outtake FMV's that were rewarded for players who collected all the P-A-C-M-A-N letters are not here with collecting the letters now simply counting to the completion percentage of the game.
  • No hub worlds at all unlike the PlayStation version which had them.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level Score / Dots / Fruits / Grand Score

title: Pac-Man World

description:
This GBA release is different from the main console version All-Star Baseball 2004 for some game elements. This portable version offers both single-player and multiplayer modes with a full license for all 30 MLB teams, stadiums and more than 800 players. Game modes include Exhibition, Season, All-star game, Home run derby, Playoffs and World series. There is no Franchise mode. Multiplayer against a second player is supported through a link cable. Through the battery back-up, progress in the season, a collection of 250 trading cards that can be earned, player trades and roster changes are stored.

During the batting phase the swing is aimed using a large triangle indicator. The direction of the hit is then determined by rotating and tilting the triangle. A similar mechanic is used for pitching during defense. During field a base is chosen using the directional pad and optionally the CPU can take over to do this automatically. The AI behavior of computer-controlled players is quite different compared to the main console version. At any moment it is possible to make substitions or adjust the position of the field players.

A new feature compared to the 2003 version is the ability for CPU pitchers to throw outside the strike zone. The increase in the base runners' speed now also allows them to do doubles or triples. There are more animations for the players, for instance the pitcher follow-throughs and the batter walk-ups. There is more visual details as well, such as a scoreboard celebrations and typical stadium details such as waving flags. Audio-wise, play-by-play commentary is a new feature for this year's version.
title: All-Star Baseball 2004

description:
Looney Tunes Double Pack is a compilation of two Looney Tunes games not available separately.

  • In Dizzy Driving, Bugs, Daffy, Tweety, and other from the gang race on tracks in vehicles using a top-down perspective. There are eight racers available.
  • In Acme Antics, Wile E. Coyote needs to catch Road Runner in side-scrolling levels shown from a side view. Road Runner needs to avoid obstacles and fight boss coyotes.
title: Looney Tunes Double Pack: Dizzy Driving / Acme Antics

description:
LEGO Knights' Kingdom is a game based on the popular toy franchise of LEGO bricks. It is the second game based on the Knights' Kingdom line of toys following the PC title LEGO Creator: Knights' Kingdom in 2000. This version is however based on the second version of the toy line, while the first game was based on the first version.

This release is an action RPG based around the hero knights Daniu, Jayko, Racus and Santis. They are on a quest to find the Heart of the magical Shield of Ages. The main story is divided into nine separate quests divided over the four knights and collected in the Story mode. Players explore an environment, solve small puzzles, battle enemies and collect loot. In Tournament Arena there are head-to-head battles and jousts divided over three further modes: Hand to Hand Combat, Jousting and Sword Lightning Combat. The antagonist Lord Vladek can be unlocked as a fifth character to fight in the Tournament mode. The Last Man Standing mode has timed battles for survival, and multiplayer against another player using a Link Cable is supported through head-to-head battles and jousts.

sample_screenshots.caption: You must smash all of the barrels to pass this trial.

title: LEGO Knights' Kingdom

description:
Backyard Baseball 2006 is an entry in the Backyard Sports series and the second Baseball title in the series to be released for the GBA, following Backyard Baseball in 2002. The game uses cartoon-like visuals and carries an MLB license presenting famous players from 30 professional teams as kid versions, with 55 neighborhood kid characters in addition. Matches take place in famous stadiums, but also in backyards. The main game modes are Pick-up Game, Season Play, Mini Games and Link Play.

In Season Play a team can be taken through a season of 16 or 32 games. Typical baseball rules are followed, but there are new elements such as the ability to earn power-ups by fulfilling certain requirements, by hitting a homerun or throwing a crazy pitch. A fireball then offers an automatic strike for instance and a metal bat turns a hit into a homerun all the time. Several fields, abilities and players are unlocked gradually through the game modes and through specific actions, such as tagging out a runner, or making a double or triple play. The Mini-games mode offers challenges based around fielding and homeruns.

Compared to the first version there are improved visuals with tweaks to the gameplay. Fields are more colourful and a red target now shows where the ball will land during the fielding. There is a large amount of customization for the games, player uniforms, abilities and options such as toggling pitch locators or player stamina. There are three difficulty levels: Rookie, Pro and Allstar.
title: Backyard Baseball 2006

description:
Backyard Skateboarding is a game in the Backyard Sports series and the fifth game in the series released for the GBA. A number of skaters gathers to raise funds to turn their backyard into a real skatepark. They participate in the Backyard Skate Tour where they help out people in the neighbourhood to earn stamps in their tour book. They start at Mom 'N' Pop's Skateshop and by earning enough stamps they can move on to another shop. Every location also has a kid acting as a boss, offering a challenge. When defeated, the kid the joins the group as a new playable character. As each kid also brings a sponsor, at the end of the game their will be enough funds to build the ultimate park Skate Station Alpha.

The game is different from the earlier PC version and uses a bird's-eye view. There are different skaters available that can be customized. Each skater has different statistics based on air, balance, flip, speed and spin. The skater is controlled directly in a scrolling environment that can be explored freely in any direction. Every location has characters with tasks or challenges to complete to earn the stamps. Tasks for instance include delivering newspapers against a time limit. The main score is shown in the top left corner as "juice". Skaters can move, jump and perform tricks. Often parts of the environments can be used for grinds and jumps using ramps.

The game includes a multiplayer mode.
title: Backyard Skateboarding

alternate_titles.title: Noddy: Um dia no País dos Brinquedos
Noddy: Un nuovo giorno a Giocattolandia
Oui-Oui: Une journée au Pays des Jouets

sample_screenshots.caption: Level Select mode - "I cannot make any ice cream!"

description:
Fear Factor: Unleashed is a game based on the US stunt/dare TV game show Fear Factor that initially ran on NBC from 2001 to 2006. The shows pits contestants against each other in a variety of stunts for a grand prize. In this adaptation a character is created at the start with minor customizability options (hair colour, skin tone and costume colour) and twenty skill points to distribute over four statistics that influence the performance: nerve, stamina, steadiness and stomach. A random type of fear is also assigned to the characters, such as acrophobia, claustrophobia, herpetophobia, tachophobia etc. The character then gets to compete in twelve mini-games based around stunts.

The main game modes are Custom, Fear Factor, Multiplayer and Practice. Each game starts with a brief explanation of the stunt and the controls that are used. One example is The Pit and the Pendulum. In a fixed screen environment shown from a side view a character is tied up near the bottom of the screen while a swinging axe descends slowly. The player needs to balance a fear meter to keep it steady while opening a lock by moving a shaft and locking barrels. In single-player the character competes against five other contestants who each get their turn with a time to beat. In another challenge, Gross Out Buffet, the character needs to gobble down Madagascar cockroaches. Examples of other challenges are Creepy Conveyor Belt (move maggots between conveyor belts using your mouth), Helicopter Havoc (use ropes to jump between helicopters in flight) and Runaway Train (obstacle course on top of a moving train). The fear meter is a returning element in each mini-game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Pit and the Pendulum introduction

title: Fear Factor: Unleashed

description:
Battle B-Daman: Fire Spirits! is an action game based on the anime TV series of the same name, which is in turn based on the B-Daman line of toys. It is a follow-up to the Battle B-Daman game released in the same year. The game is mainly about one-to-one battles between two robots interspersed with some story elements. By winning matches new parts become available offering customization options. The battles are played from a first-person perspective where the robot can only be moved left or right, firing coloured plastic balls to damage the opponent and avoiding the incoming attacks.

The story revolves around the character Yamato Delgado who, after becoming a B-Dachampion, now enters the Winners Tournament. Most of the game he is in search of Strike Shots that will help him ensure victories. It initially follows the story of the early anime episodes, but then changes introducing a new antagonist called Death Poker Alliance. They are after the Petrified Parts Yamato is looking for.

The game contains a main Adventure mode focusing on the store as well as a Battle mode. There are also six mini-games: Battle Shoot, Gate Check, Puzzle Wall, Snipe Shoot, Target Bug and Target Hit.

There are many strategic elements during the battles based on different special and charged attacks. The Zero System concept of the original game is replaced with the Blaster Core System. It allows for the customization of special moves by equipping a specific core.
title: Battle B-Daman: Fire Spirits!

alternate_titles.title: Die Biene Maja: Das große Abenteuer

description: In Maya the Bee: The Great Adventure Maya the Bee goes off to find her missing friend Willie, before the day is up. The player navigates Maya through a sixteen platforming stages collecting flowers, dodging foes and uncovering secret rooms along the way. Each new level features new traps, foes and gameplay mechanics that make the game progressively harder.
title: Maya the Bee: The Great Adventure

description:
The GBA version of Bratz Forever Diamondz is different from the versions for other platforms. The premise is identical: based on the 2006 direct-to-DVD film of the same name, players help the Bratz quartet (Cloe, Jade, Sasha and Yasmin) travel across the United States in a truck in search of the hottest fashion designer for the 'America Rocks Fashion' TV show competition. The winner of the competition will then receive the grand prize: A pair of go-go boots studded with several diamonds.

The girls use the truck to travel between locations and it can be customized with different designs and colors. The driving is a short mini-game shown from a behind view where heart-shaped items called 'blingz' are collected while a timer counts down. In the location the girls arrive at there are short story sequences and different types of activities need to be completed such as finding an assistant, assisting the people with tasks or buying and items using the 'blingz' currency. In these sections the girls are controlled directly in turns with a scrolling bird's-eye view.

More currency is earned through short mini-games such as a game of volleyball, collecting blingz while rollerskating against a time limit, designing a flyer or participating in a dance competition. There is an overview of all objectives that need to be completed. It is possible to talk to most of the characters. Once everything is done, the girls drive to a new location where a new set of objectives needs to be completed.
title: Bratz Forever Diamondz

description:
Blades of Thunder is a 3D action game about controlling a helicopter during military missions. The story revolves around defeating a terrorist organization called The Solar Martyrs targetting oil refineries in the Middle East. During gameplay the helicopter is shown using a behind view. It has a pseudo 3D environment and it is one of the first games to employ voxel technology on the GBA. The helicopter can be steered freely combining strafing with changing the altitude for evasive manoeuvrers. There are separate controls to move the crosshairs. The main action usually revolves around taking out units in the air, on the ground or at sea, but there are also escorting tasks or protecting allied vehicles and buildings.

Three types of environments are used with snowy areas, deserts and a generic European setting. In the bottom right a radar shows enemy units. Enemies also use radars as vehicles and these can be taken out to draw less attention. Other parts of the hud display remaining lives, the amount of health, the remaining ammo for the unguided Hydra rockets and lock-on Homing Missiles (the regular machine gun has infinite ammo) and the total score. Later levels introduce power-ups to provide additional damage or the ability to fire multiple rockets in one shot. Health and ammo are replenished by flying over pick-up stations.

There are ten levels with primary and secondary objectives and each one starts with a short briefing. There are also bosses to defeat. There are three difficulty levels and a password system is used. At the end of a mission a total mission score is calculated based on the amount of units destroyed, the amount of secondary objectives completed and bonuses.
title: Blades of Thunder

description:
Babar To The Rescue is a game based around Babar the Elephant, a character from Jean de Brunhoff's children's books. It consists of a series of nine levels played in a fixed order. There are three types of gameplay and these are repeated with some variations. The included levels are:* Balloon Ride: control Babar in a hot air balloon in a 2D side-scrolling environment. Collect crowns and avoid obstacles and enemies to make it to the children.

  • Across the Rivers: a side-scrolling platform game where Babar needs to make it past water sections, using platforms, swinging with vines and collecting crowns.

  • Jungle Rally: a top-down, vertically scrolling racing game where Babar needs to collect crows and avoid obstacles. There are also ramps that can be used. The car is steered and can be sped up or down.

  • The Savannah: similar to Across the Rivers but now in a savannah that is on fire.

  • Down the River: similar to Jungle Rally but now on a river controlling a speedboat.

  • In the Snow: similar to Across the Rivers and The Savannah, but now in a frozen environment.

  • Motorcycle Rally: similar to the previous two racing sections, but now on a motorcycle.

  • Off to the Island: the platforming mini-game, but with a new setting and with the ability to swim and explore underwater. Babar needs to go back to the surface regularly to fill his oxygen meters or his points are drained.

  • Going Home: a variation of the first Balloon Ride level as Babar needs to get back home.

There are short story sequences between levels shown as static images and overall progresses through the levels is shown on a map. The game emphasizes the score a lot and keeps track of the highscore.
title: Babar To The Rescue

description:
The GBA version of Avatar: The Last Airbender is different from the releases for other platformers. In this adaptation of the animated TV series Aang and his friends investigate the disappearance of the Waterbender Hiryu and discover it has been happening regularly.

Controlling only Aang at the start, a group of three characters is soon formed with Katara and Sokka joining. The group moves together and the player can switch between them at any moment to take control of a specific one. It is mainly played as an action game, exploring the environment, dodging hazards and fighting enemies using a bird's-eye view, but there is also a strong element of environment based puzzle-solving.

Characters can push boxes to manipulate the environment and they each have different abilities. Aang can use a high jump to reach high ledges, Sokka can activate switches using a boomerang and Katara can construct bridges. Characters have a health meter as well as a stamina meter that is drained when performing actions and then quickly refills again.
title: Avatar: The Last Airbender

description:
The Barbie Diaries: High School Mystery is a game based on the 2006 movie The Barbie Diaries. The game is set in Barbie's high school where valuable items for the high school charity auction have gone missing. By locating these Barbie cannot only help the school, but it will also help her land the TV anchor position currently held by Raquelle, a girl she does not like.

The game is largely played as an adventure game where Barbie explores the environment, talks to characters and uses a large variety of tech tools to locate and inspect clues. All available tools are accessible through the BDA (Barbie Diary Assistant). Examples are an Infrared Viewer, an MP3 Decoder or a Picture Descrambler. There are nineteen locations in total to explore with a map that provides an overview. The clues are stored in a separate screen and there is also an overview of the current objectives. The sequences where the tech tools are used are also available as mini-games at the main menu.
title: The Barbie Diaries: High School Mystery

description:
Agent Hugo: RoboRumble is an action game starring Hugo the troll, here part of the Agent Hugo science fiction reboot first introduced in 2005. Agent Hugo needs to take on Geekdorph who threatens the world. He is a scientist who inserted his own brain into a robot and he is now the lord of a robot army. Agent Hugo needs to infiltrate his robot factory using Tex 2000, a futuristic hoverboard.

In 2D-sidescrolling levels Hugo moves at a fast speed and can move vertically between lanes to pick up items or avoid hazards. He is always on top of the hoverboard and he can shoot, jump and activate a shield device. Tricks can also be performed while in the air.

A mission is completed when the end of the track is reached. The game keeps tracks of the completion time, the score based on item pick-ups and the number of kills. Lanes often have gaps that need to be avoided. There also jump pads and arrows that provide additional speed. The HUD shows the passed time, total score, current speed, track completion percentage and number of kills. A retry is provided for every death and a password is provided when a mission is completed.
title: Agent Hugo: RoboRumble

description: This simple puzzle adventure game based on the manga and anime series Tokyo Mew Mew follows main character Ichigo on one especially complicated day out. She planned to spend it on a nice date with Aoyama, but when Quiche manages to steal a memory chip containing the secret identities of all the Mew Mews, Ichigo has to scramble to get it back. The story is told through linear visual novel scenes with the occasional sliding tile puzzles in the place of battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ichigo's out on a day in the park...
We have to match the images while they're animating on screen, which is vaguely challenging.

title: Hamepane Tokyo Mew Mew

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to disarm a rat trap

description:
Little League Baseball 2002 is a baseball game carrying the Little League Baseball license of the organization that organizes local youth baseball and softball leagues throughout the United States and the rest of the world.

Different teams are available each with different statistics based on batting, fielding and pitching. Game options include a difficulty level selection, adjusting the amount of innings and a selection of different fields. Before the start of the game the batting order can be determined.

During the batting phase a behind view is used when swinging with an orange circle that can be moved around green cross-hairs to strike at the right time. When pitching the same perspective is used with a red dot moved around the green cross-hairs, a separate bar for pitching power and four options for the pitch type. During field play the perspective shifts to a bird's-eye view.
title: Little League Baseball 2002

description:
Battle B-Daman is a game based on the B-Daman marble shooting toy produced in Japan by Takara, and more specifically the Battle B-Daman manga adaptation by Eiji Inuki. The game follows Yamato Delgado who dreams of playing B-Daman, the traditional sports game of the B-Daworld. The goal is to battle various B-DaPlayers to compete in the Winner's Tournament. To get there he needs to find all parts of a Cobalt Blade.

The game is mainly about one-to-one battles between two robots interspersed with some story elements. By winning matches new parts become available offering customization options. The battles are played from a first-person perspective where the robot can only be moved left or right, firing coloured plastic balls to damage the opponent and avoiding the incoming attacks. There are two ways to battle: Direct Hit Battle or B-Daman Invasion. A button is used to shoot while a B-DaSpirit gauge fills up gradually. When the D-Pad shape starts blinking along with red triangles and different directions, the B button can be pressed along with the direction of the red triangle to launch a Special Attack. These Special Attacks vary throughout the game based on the B-Daman customization and equipment.
title: Battle B-Daman

description: The Game Boy Advance version of Starsky & Hutch is different from the console versions, but still a racing game in full 3D. The 3D polygonal graphics are very different and the violence has been toned down due to Nintendo's policies. Some of the voice-overs are intact, and others are absent, due to the GBA's limitations. The episodes are presented as levels, and split into groups.

sample_screenshots.caption: Chase The Ace - Stop the car!
Collect as much as you can!

title: Starsky & Hutch

description:
This Hasbro board game compilation features the three board games of the same name. Based off the selection of those games, the compilation seems to be themed towards luck and young children, as a structurally similar compilation featuring "The Game of Life," "Pay Day," and "Yahtzee" themes to chance and economics. Each game gives the player the option to have each participant either be played by a person or the computer itself; the player can even make every player a computer player and watch the action in the chosen board game.

"Candy Land" has participants try to navigate the location stated in the title to meet King Kandy. Two to four players can participate. Each space either is of a solid color, includes an icon corresponding to a location, can transport the player through shortcuts, or can hold him/her back from finishing the game. Movement is done by a deck of cards; the card drawn from the top by a player directs him/her to the next space to transport to. A solid-colored square card tells the player to move to the next space with that color; cards can have two squares, which have the player move to the second space of the same color in his/her path. Location cards have the player transport straight to the space corresponding to those cards. The first to make it to Candy Castle, where King Kandy is located, wins.

"Chutes & Ladders" involves spinning a six-space wheel to progress through the 10 x 10 space board. Once again, two to four players may play this game. Although many of the spaces numbered 1-100 have nothing happening, some are located at the ends of ladders and slides. If the player reaches the bottom of a ladder, he/she can climb it to the top; if the player reaches the top of a slide, he/she must slide down it to the bottom. Each ladder and slide represent certain scenarios, where ladders involve positive actions leading to positive consequences and slides involve negative actions leading to negative consequences. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

"Original Memory Game" plays the same as the card-matching game of concentration. This time, one to four players can play, and the number of cards can be chosen; either 20, 42, or 72 cards can be played on. The cards begin face down; the player chooses two cards to flip over. If the cards are the same, the cards are removed from the game and the player gains a point. With multiple players, if a player finds a match, he/she can keep taking turns until that player finds a pair of different cards. The goal is to have the most points if competing with other players, or to find all matches if playing independently.

sample_screenshots.caption: The playing field; the arrow turns and determines the number of squares you move forward
Title screen of the Candyland game

title: Candy Land / Chutes & Ladders / Original Memory Game

description:
Three board games are playable in this compilation, which, like the title suggests, are "The Game of Life," "Pay Day," and "Yahtzee." Based off this selection, the compilation is seemingly themed especially to economics and chance. Each time a game is selected, the player has the option to select the number of players, along with whether each player is to be controlled by person or computer.

"The Game of Life," which allows two to four players, involves progressing through many events from the start of college or work, to retirement. The wheel, which can land on numbers 1-10, is meant to determine how many spaces (or sometimes how much money) the player proceeds (or gains). Each space can either mean earning or losing money, and/or it can affect the process of the players/opponent(s) through the game. A few spaces, however, must be landed on by every player. The goal is to retire with the most money.

"Pay Day" is similar to "The Game of Life" in that the player must have the most money to win, and two to four players can participate. However, the length of the game can be determined, as the game (which is shaped like a calendar) can range from one to six months. The player may land on spaces that, once again, affect the amount of money possessed by oneself or others. There are "Lottery," "Event," and "Auction" spaces to name a few. At the end of each month is the "Pay Day" space.

"Yahtzee" has the player roll dice to obtain certain combinations for points. Like the other two games, two through four players can participate; however, this game can also be a single-player experience. Each player gets to roll up to three times to try to fulfill their dice combination; one could try to roll ones, twos, threes, fours, fives, sixes, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house, small straight, large straight, or Yahtzee. If the player feels dissatisfied about the results, he/she can place the score for that turn into the "Chance" section; however, the score of each turn must go into one open space corresponding to one of the mentioned combinations. The most points earned wins.
title: The Game of Life / Yahtzee / Payday

description:
Based on the TV show and special of the same name, this game has the player complete a total of 20 different levels. Story Mode and Play Any Game are the two choices the player has when in the main menu.

Story Mode has the player select any level he/she wants to play from the 20, and go from there to the end. There are four levels each for France, Tanzania, Russia, and China; there are two for Dora's home once back from China. The first level of each involves going from country to country in varying modes of transportation. The second level of all five regions usually involves navigating through mazes and collecting three items. Only the second level in Russia has to do with skiing. The third in each of the four countries outside the Americas may vary between each other. The final one in each of the four have to do with finding each respective country's version of Swiper. The difficulty rises throughout the game in certain aspects. Also, the player may pause the game, but may not exit the level until it is finished.

The level select menu is set up so the player first looks at two pages, each displaying about half of Earth. Then, once a location is selected, the player can choose from any section of the game in that region. Though Dora's home is a choice in both globe pages, the first takes the player to the beginning of the story, while the second takes the player towards the end. There are no levels in the first Americas choice, but the plot starts there. Play Any Game lets the player choose from any of the 20 levels to play. Once finished with it, the player goes back to the region's game select menu.

The plot goes as follows: Today is Friendship Day, a worldwide celebration when friendship bracelets are worn by everyone. When worn, the bracelets will make the sky brighter by glowing. However, Swiper swiped friendship bracelets with his Swiper-copter, leaving the people of France, Tanzania, Russia, and China (mainly Paris, Mt.
