Kilimanjaro, the Winter Palace, and the Great Wall of China respectively) without them. Once realizing that the items swiped were friendship bracelets, Swiper felt repentance. After the Swiper-copter failed to work again, Dora and Swiper must return them back to those four countries a different way. Will they save Friendship Day?

sample_screenshots.caption: Second half of the game (freeform mode)
Mini game hide and seek on the Eiffel Tower

title: Dora the Explorer: Dora's World Adventure

description:
Backyard Football 2006 is an NFL-licensed American football game geared towards kids with a cartoon style. It is the second Backyard Football game for the GBA. Game modes include pickup games, exhibition matches, season play, practice games and multiplayer. There are three difficulty levels and options to toggle power-ups, fatigue and turnovers. Teams are divided over a Frontyard and a Backyard conference with multiple teams for each one, further divided into four groups: East, North, South and West. In total there are 32 NFL teams and 19 exclusive backyard teams.

There are multiple environments to choose from along with the weather options sun and rain. Each player has different statistics based on running, passing, catching, kicking and block/tackle. Custom characters can be created. In Exhibition matches the player and the computer take turns selecting a player to build a team. Matches have optional pre- and post-game commentary through an animated sequence. Multiplay plays and strategies are supported.

Gameplay is shown through a side-scrolling bird's-eye view from the sideline. Some actions have a power meter that builds and depletes automatically; the player then has to time carefully to hit at the right moment and determine the power of the action. The game is in full 3D. After each important action strategies can be switched. The game also always offers a recommended play.
title: Backyard Football 2006

description:
This compilation contains:* Dexter's Laboratory: Deesaster Strikes!

  • The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo Jojo A-Go-Go

There are two cartridges, one for each game.
title: Cartoon Combo: The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo Jojo A-Go-Go / Dexter's Laboratory: Deesaster Strikes!

description: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Advance is the first handheld adaptation in the Tokyo Xtreme Racer \ Shutokō Battle series of street racing games. Races are set in Los Angeles, London and Tokyo with more than 16 cars to choose from. Car can be upgraded with performance and style modifications. Over 60 rivals can be faced.
title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Advance

description: In stark contrast to its Xbox and PlayStation 2 counter-parts, The Bible Game on Game Boy Advance is an isometric, action-adventure game that is trivia-centric. The Master Deceiver is on the hunt and the only way to stop him is to find and wear the Armor of God. The six pieces of the armor have been scattered amongst the lands within six different churches. It is the player's job to collect each piece and assemble the Armor of God. There are three difficulty levels within the game: Easy, Medium, and Hard.
title: The Bible Game

description:
The 5 Golden Fruits are stolen by a gang of ghosts and darkness falls over the land and the evil spirit Spooky is unleashed. It is up to Pac-Man to get the Golden Fruit back and restore order in Pac-Land. Run, bounce, roll, and swim your way through a variety of worlds to find the hidden fruits. There are also extra hidden Galaxian keys which unlock classic Pac-man mazes.

Pac-Man World 2 is a side-scrolling platform game which has some depth to the play-field to allow for more movement than just left and right. There are a bunch of moves Pac-Man can pull off, such as a butt-bounce, a rev roll, a flip-kick or a rev jump. Some of these are dual function and aid in both reaching higher platforms or getting up steeper hills, as well as attacking enemies.

The game also features a password system to get back to levels you have already played.
title: Pac-Man World 2

description:
All Grown Up!: Express Yourself is based on the successor of the Rugrats show. In this game, players take control of Angelica, who is running the school newspaper.

Each story that she is working on is considered as a mission. Players will need to complete 8 missions in total.

The Story Chase mode's gameplay involves finding the right character to talk to and sometimes finding and giving them specific items and playing mini-games to progress through the game. The mini-games that players complete in the story chase can then be played separately. Completing a mission awards players with a copy of the Class Paper.

There are additional options in the game such as choosing which accessories Angelica will wear as well as switching the background music, image and character seen and heard in the menu, a PDA where players can make their own To Do lists, fill in personal details about them and their friends or take a quiz to find out which character from the TV series they resemble the most.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each mini-game has an explanation how to play it.
Great! And you know what that means.
Each mission starts with a short cutscene.
The menu that players can customize.

title: All Grown Up! Express Yourself

description: Ed, Edd n Eddy: The Mis-Edventures is a 2-D side scrolling platformer. The game follows the Ed's quest to obtain as many jawbreakers as possible, which can either be found in the game world or purchased from candy machines for $1 accumulated from collecting pennies. The game features six distinct areas to explore and retains much of the art style and humor found in the TV show. Enemies encountered include dogs, squirrels, birds, and even water sprinklers and garden rakes. Characters from the show such as Kevin, Rolf, and the Kanker Sisters also make an appearance.
title: Ed, Edd n Eddy: The Mis-Edventures

sample_screenshots.caption: After clearing the level, here's the statistics.
Kelsi speaks with Gabriella and Taylor.
If you win, you can continue.

title: High School Musical: Livin' the Dream

description:
Based on the 4Kids Entertainment adaptation of the One Piece anime and released exclusively in the United States, this sidescrolling action game features the adventures of Monkey D. Luffy in the East Blue. Recruiting his pirate crew, facing off against enemies with unusual powers, and facing of with the Navy as he travels between islands, players fight their way through seven Stories that consist of three stages each, the first two being platforming stages with the final level of a Story being a boss battle.

Combat involves utilizing Luffy's rubber body to pull off moves like stretching his arm to attack from afar or inflating to deflect bullets, although most of the generic pirate enemies are defeated with a simple punch combo or aerial kick. The stretchy limbs also factor into level navigation like grabbing onto poles to launch Luffy to higher places or grabbing items that would otherwise be out of reach. Landing attacks will build up a power meter that can be used for either a special attack or to have Luffy's crew members to leap in and assist with their own attacks or by providing useful items.

Between Stories a timed Ship Battle Royale takes place where the player needs to defeat all the enemies within a time limit. An infinite variation of this mode is unlocked through completing the main story, and by collecting pirate coins in the platforming levels the player can also unlock a boss rush mode.
title: Shonen Jump's One Piece

description:
Based on the Japan-exclusive traveling exhibition Jurassic Park Institute Tour, this minigame collection has players taking part in five different dinosaur-themed minigames.

  • Cross Dinosaur: A simple Frogger-style game. A helicopter lands on the far side of a field, and players have to dodge rampaging dinosaurs to reach it. Each person who reaches the helicopter gives the player 10 points, and the game continues until the player is hit by dinosaurs three times.
  • Danger Zone: A sidescrolling game similar to Cross Dinosaur. Players control a dinosaur moving from the grass on the left side of the screen to a cave on the right while dodging falling rocks propelled from an active volcano.
  • Egg Guard: Players control a mother dinosaur guarding her nest from humans who are coming from all eight directions. Players can scare away egg thieves by facing them straight on, but will lose a life if they let the thief reach the eggs.
  • Rexercise: A "Simon Says"-style game. Players control a dinosaur who must remember sequences of button presses. Every time the player completes a round, players another button is added to the end. The game ends after the player makes three mistakes.
  • Take Meat: Players control a mother dinosaur caring for her child. The nest is on one side of the screen, while some meat is on the other side. From a sidescrolling perspective, players have to make their way to the right side and fetch food, then bring it back safely to the nest while dodging falling rocks.

sample_screenshots.caption: The gallery view has various bits of unlockable artwork.

title: Jurassic Park Institute Tour: Dinosaur Rescue

description:
The handheld version of Power Rangers: Ninja Storm is a side-scrolling action game where players take control of one of the 6 available Power Rangers, with some of them being grouped.

The choice of available rangers is as follows: Group:* Red, Blue, Yellow Wind Rangers

  • Group: Crimson, Navy Thunder Rangers
  • Solo: Green Samurai Ranger

Players can switch into any of the rangers in the groups by pressing Select. Pressing Select while playing as the Green Samurai Ranger makes him do a special attack which harms all surrounding enemies.

Each ranger also has their own special attack which takes time to recharge and in each group the rangers have one out of two standard weapons they can attack with. In order to switch one weapon to the other, the rangers must destroy boxes and pick up the weapon. Usually, one of the weapons is a close-range sword, while the other is a longer-range weapon such as a blaster or a long fire blade for the Green Samurai Ranger. Collecting the same weapon will also level up the weapon making it do more damage.

After going through the stage and defeating the boss in combat, players switch to a megazord battle where they must press the A and B button, as well as a direction button in time to do an attack on the enemy. When the meter on the bottom is almost completely red and the enemy is almost defeated, players can do a stronger attack by pressing one of the buttons simultaneously with the R button and doing that successfully will prompt players to use an item to attack.
title: Power Rangers: Ninja Storm

description:
Operation Armored Liberty is a Game Boy Advance remake of Super Battletank. Taking place during the invasion of Iraq, the player controls a lone M1A1 Abrams Main Battle Tank from the first-person viewpoint. Each of the ten levels requires the player to defeat all enemies on the map to proceed. To accomplish this, players are given several different weapons and abilities, including their tank's main cannon and a smoke screen. Levels three and onward feature boss battles against a static objective at the end of each level. The player is also given the opportunity to visit friendly bases to repair damage and rearm their tank.

Despite the gameplay being similar to the original SNES release of Super Battletank, there are some changes made in Operation Armored Liberty. The game's time period has been updated to feature the more recent 2003 Invasion of Iraq in contrast to the original's setting in Operation Desert Storm. Operation Armored Liberty also features a password save system and allows for unlimited retries after failing a level. Gameplay has also been changed as the player now has an unlimited fire rate for their main cannon and are no longer able to traverse their turret left or right.
title: Operation Armored Liberty

description:
Sena Kobayakawa has just started attending Deimon Private Senior High School, and he's already getting picked on by bullies. His saving grace is his incredible speed, which he can use to escape sticky situations. Sena's talent is noticed by Yoichi Hiruma, the captain of the school's American football club, and so he forcibly recruits Sena as the team's running back under an alias: Eyeshield 21.

Although the manga this game is based on, Eyeshield 21, revolves around American Football, Devilbats Devildays follows the misadventures of Sena and co. while they're off the field. The main game has the player going through text-adventure style paths which lead to different endings as well as playing a variety of mini-games.
title: Eyeshield 21: Devilbats Devildays

description:
Drake & Josh is a game based on the Nickelodeon TV series. Drake and Josh are misfit brothers who are already dealing with school, girlfriends, and their cunning, mischievous younger sister who is always pulling pranks on them. Trouble will take on a whole new meaning with Drake's new employment, Josh's new promotion, and some unexpected visitors. Puzzles, stealth, strategy, action, and more are all game elements.

Interact with Drake, Josh, and Megan after playing as both Drake and Josh. Assist Drake in charming all of the ladies with his guitar while avoiding being splattered in the craziest food battle ever.
title: Drake & Josh
Need for Speed: Carbon - Own the City

description:
Lizzie McGuire 2: Lizzie Diaries is largely a 2D side-scrolling platformer based on the Disney American comedy television series that ran between 2001 and 2004. Lizzie needs to complete levels avoiding obstacles and enemies. The latter can also be taken out by jumping on top of them. Lizzie has a limited amount of health, but when dead a level does not need to be restarted completely and the number of lives is infinite. The main goal is to reach the end of the level but optionally a certain number of diary collectibles can be picked up. In one level she needs to stay ahead of cheerleaders that chase her through the entire level.

Next to the regular platforming other levels contain several activities and mini-games such as playing games of beach volleyball, badminton, surviving a food fight, completing a waterski course, mimicking a dancing routine, dressing up Lizzie with a correct outfit, a time management game as a waitress and so on.
title: Lizzie McGuire 2: Lizzie Diaries

description:
Hachiemon and his friends are having a lovely day on Hachi Isle, when a strange incident occurs. The friends that came to play with him have suddenly lost their lips! Without lips, eating and talking are difficult for them. Time for Hachiemon to be a hero and get everyone their lips back!

Hachiemon is a 2D platformer starring the titular egg-shaped character with big red angled lips. He can use his lips in various ways, throwing them like a boomerang or grabbing onto walls and platforms, even slingshotting himself. Some enemies can be stunned temporarily by giving them a quick smooch with his lips. He can also roll to attack, but rolling for too long makes him dizzy. Many enemies, obstacles, and occasional boss fights stand in the way of his quest for the lost lips.

The Hachiemon character was originally created as an advertising mascot for the TV station KTV (Kansai Television or Kantele for short). In game, Hachiemon sometimes exclaims "Kantele" (カンテーレ), like on the title screen or when pushing the left shoulder button.

Hachiemon comments on some events, like pausing, smooching or getting hurt, with voice clips in which he has a comically deep and expressionless voice.

sample_screenshots.caption: On to the shopping district of Osaka

title: Hachiemon

sample_screenshots.caption: All We Need Is Love Intro
Always Look On The Bright Side Intro

alternate_titles.title: Green Eggs and Ham By Dr. Seuss

sample_screenshots.caption: Move left and right to grab Green Eggs and Ham

title: Dr. Seuss: Green Eggs and Ham

sample_screenshots.caption: Strawberry Shortcake and her pet Pupcake.
Crossing the chocolate river and collecting marshmallows.

alternate_titles.title: Expedition der Stachelbeeren: Zoff im Zoo!
La Famille Delajungle: A la Poursuite de Darwin

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing as Darwin and collecting cheese munchies.
Nigel is about to begin his TV show.

description: Dogz 2 is an expanded version of the original Game Boy Advance Dogz game. Although it features the same story and artwork, the gameplay has been updated with more options. There are six new dog breeds compared to the original game, two new tricks to teach your dog, and three new minigames.
title: Dogz 2
Barbie as The Princess and the Pauper

description: WWF Road to WrestleMania is the first WWF game released for the Game Boy Advance. It is played from a side view view point in which the player selects a wrestler to compete. It features superstars such as Stone Cold, The Rock, The Undertaker, Triple H, X-Pac, Billy Gunn, Bob Holly, Raven, and 16 more. They all have unique entrances and move sets. There are multiple match types such as single, tag team, cage, iron man, hardcore, among others. The singleplayer mode consists of regular exhibition matches or a full season with the end goal of reaching the premier event of WrestleMania. Up to four human players can compete with the Gamelink peripheral.
title: WWF Road to WrestleMania

description: Teen Titans is based on the cartoon of the same name. Players control the five team members: Robin, Cyborg, Raven, Starfire and Beast Boy and can switch between them at any time. Robin and Cyborg can double jump, while Raven, Starfire and Beast Boy can fly. All the Titans have unique abilities that allow them to surpass certain obstacles. The Titans must use these abilities to navigate various levels to defeat Brother Blood and his H.I.V.E. academy cohorts.
title: Teen Titans

alternate_titles.title: Harry Potter: Coupe du Monde de Quidditch
Harry Potter: La Coppa del Mondo di Quidditch
Harry Potter: Quidditch Copa del Mundo

description: The game relates to the story of the movie "Ice Age" with the player taking control of Manny to take him across ten levels carrying the lost human baby Roshan to return him to his kind. In each level, the player finds acorns which act as health. Enemies are countered by jumping on them, stomping the ground, walloping them with Manny's trunk or by launching a giant acorn. Some of the levels will have the player take control of Sid to run through a hazardous plain with various pitfalls and enemies until he reaches the end. When a certain number of acorns remains in the player's inventory by the end of a level, the player can acquire extra content.
title: Ice Age

sample_screenshots.caption: Taking the bike out for a spin

description: A golf game part of the Golf Shiyou yo series with licences for the Tomy property Kurohige Kiki Ippatsu (Pop-up Pirate).
title: Kurohige no Golf Shiyōyo

description: Ochaken no Heya is the first in a long series of virtual pet games based on the Sega Toys Ochaken line, featuring cute dogs and cats with tea leaves for ears. Players adopt tea dogs and cats to live in a room that players can decorate and organize to their heart's content. There are 10 different ochaken and ochaneko in total, along with over 200 different furnishings. Players can earn in-game currency to shop for furniture by playing various card and puzzle minigames; there are eight different card games, and three kinds of puzzles. Players can also play the card games with up to three other players using the GBA link cable.
title: Ochaken no Heya

description: Ochaken Kururin is a falling block puzzle game based on the Sega Toys line Ochaken, which features cute dogs and cats with tea leaves for ears. This is essentially a rethemed version of MTO's earlier puzzle game Wanko de Kururin! Wankuru, featuring the same rules but new gameplay design. Players control blocks in sets of two which can be rotated in any direction, like in Puyo Puyo. The pieces are either a tea animal or a cup of tea. If a teacup is set down next to an animal of the same colour, all matching animals in the chain will enter the teacup and disappear, scoring the player points. Players can play versus the CPU or another player using the GBA's link cable.
title: Ochaken Kururin: Honwaka Puzzle no Hotto Shiyo?

description:
Ochaken no Yume Bouken is a simple, child-friendly 2D platformer based on the Sega Toys Ochaken line, which features cute dogs and cats with tea leaves for ears. Players control one of a number of different ochaken through sidescrolling levels, with the ability to jump and to hover short distance by flapping their tea leaf ears. The levels feature other ochaken and ochaneko hanging out who the players can speak with; players can also collect items and deliver them to friends in simple side quests.

Players can also create their own custom ochaken using various colours, body parts, and accessories. Players can play the main game using their custom character, and can import them into Ochaken no Heya DS 2.
title: Ochaken no Yume Bouken

description:
Ochaken no Bouken Shima follows up Ochaken no Yume Bouken for a new adventure starring Sega Toys's tea dog and cat characters. This is a simple, child-friendly 2D platformer. This time, players can play as either a dog or a cat. Like in the first game, dogs can hover short distances by flapping their tea leaf ears; cats, meanwhile, are able to double jump. This game also features a detailed character creation system, and players are able to play as their custom designed dog or cat in the main game. Custom characters can also be imported into the later game Ochaken no Heya DS 2.

As a bonus, new copies came with a small ochaneko toy.
title: Ochaken no Boukenjima: Honwaka Yume no Island

description:
The Morning Adventure: Mananitos Bollycao is a platform game in which you control Mañanito Boy, a young man who has a somewhat busy morning ahead of him. To face it, he must eat all the Bollycaos and Mañanitos that he can. The Mañanitos work as a kind of temporary power-up that will allow him to run faster and jump higher. The life indicator is made up of three milk bottles. With each touch of the enemies, you lose one of them.

It is a promotional game only available in Spain with 3000 copies. It could be acquired by buying Panrico bread rolls in a supermarket.
title: The Morning Adventure: Mananitos Bollycao

description:
Crash & Spyro Superpack is a compilation of two previously released Game Boy Advance games on a single cartridge:

  • Crash Bandicoot Purple: Ripto's Rampage
  • Spyro Orange: The Cortex Conspiracy
title: Crash & Spyro Superpack
SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom
SpongeBob SquarePants: Revenge of the Flying Dutchman

description: The Itsudemo Puzzle is a simple puzzle game starring the same cast as BeeWorks's Guru Guru. Players control a witch named Straw who is tasked with organizing the constellations in the sky. Using a cursor, players can nudge stars up and down; once they've aligned a gorup of stars into a straight line, they score points. As the game continues, players have to be able to deal with groups of stars physically close to each other, meaning that it becomes more difficult to find ways to organize lines properly. Completing lines within a short time period grants the player bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Intro - Staw's teacher calls her over to give her a task.
Clearing a first line. This one is simple, and there's nothing else to get in the way.

title: The Itsudemo Puzzle: Massugu Soroete Straws
The Incredibles: Rise of the Underminer
Codename: Kids Next Door - Operation: S.O.D.A.

description:
Dora, while playing catch with boots, overthrew the ball. While looking for it, Dora and Boots met Pirate Pig, who offered them to help him search for his treasure chest.

Based on the Nick Jr. television series, this platformer carries the player through eight locations on the map. In each location, three levels require the player to play as Dora and/or Boots to collect three stars. 30 coins also scatter each level, yet they are optional. Varying items, which help the player progress, are placed in each level. However, watch out for Swiper, who sneaks around, trying to steal your collected items.
title: Dora the Explorer: The Search for Pirate Pig's Treasure

description:
This game features the three Hasbro board games mentioned in the title. Each board game maintains the option of having the music and sound effects on or off.

Mouse Trap has players build a contraption and attempt to trap each other with it. Two to four players can play, and at least one if the players must be controlled by a person. Players are mice who navigate around the edge of the board; spaces can either let a player obtain or lose cheese (which can be used by him/her to move mice when the contraption is complete and he/she is on the "turn crank" space), allow a piece of the contraption to be added (if the space displays the number of players), move the player to a different space, start the finished contraption (around the end of the board), or do nothing (whether it is the safe space or a build space without showing the number of players). The contraption may run when one of the mice is on the cheese wheel at the end of the board while another mouse is on the space that starts the contraption; the mouse on the cheese wheel gets trapped and therefore eliminated. The last one standing wins.

Operation lets players take on medical roles to remove objects from a patient named Cavity Sam. One to four human players can play on either easy, medium, or hard mode. Each player can choose one of four human portraits to represent him/herself. "Classic", "speed," "skill," and "skill + speed" are the four modes available. In "classic," the player draws the top card from the deck, which states a certain job, whether it is "doctor" or "specialist." On the other side of the card is the object to remove from Cavity Sam, along with the cash reward. The player must choose to commit to the procedure if he/she is the only one playing; the player also has the choice to turn down the offer if there are multiple players. If the player succeeds, he/she gets paid the said amount and the item is removed from the game. If he/she touches the silver edges, the item stays and no profit is made. "Speed" has players remove objects in 15 seconds (which is really about 30 seconds); another possibility of operation failure, which is the time running down to 0, is featured in this mode. "Skill" has players remove an object with a hand that gets more shaky as it gets closer to the object. In single player games, the player wins when all items are removed; in multiplayer games, the player with the most money wins. High scores based on money made are also available.

Simon is a memorization game which has players repeat what is played by the machine itself. The pattern gets one additional button press for every next level. The game, which consists of four buttons, only allows one player to participate. Levels can be changed between one and four, which ranges from combinations of 8 to 14 to 20 to 31. The game is over when either the player messes up a pattern once or completes the level played on. High scores based on pattern levels are also available.
title: Mouse Trap / Operation / Simon

description:
Released with the GameCube/PlayStation 2/Xbox version along with its PC counterpart, this video game is based on the film of the same name and was released with that movie on the same day. Unlike the other versions this is a side-scrolling 2D platformer with condensed gameplay to meet the technical standards of the Game Boy Advance.

Charlie Bucket is a young, humble, chocolate-loving child who lives with a family in poverty. One day, Willy Wonka, the mysterious man who runs his own chocolate factory in Charlie's municipality created a contest; five golden tickets, one in each Wonka chocolate bar, were dispersed randomly around the world. Recipients of each ticket win a one-day tour around Wonka's factory, and one of the five winners will win a prize beyond one's dreams. Will Charlie find one of the tickets? If so, will he be the one lucky winner?

There are three save slots available. Upon choosing a save slot to use, the player gets taken to the game type menu. He/she may choose Adventure, Mini-Games, or Oompa-Loompa Album. In Adventure, the player gets to complete the games 14 main levels that follows loosely the main movie story line. The player can complete the first level, In Town, and collect 25 square candies that look round throughout each of eight levels to unlock one illustration each in the Oompa-Loompa Album; It has nine illustrations in total. The player can also find all five letters that make up WONKA in each of five levels to unlock one mini-game each; five mini-games are available to unlock. For both the mini-games and photo album, the player initially starts with none to play or look at.

The player starts with five lives, and has a life bar of five segments, which resemble connected pieces of chocolate. When the player's life bar is low, a full Wonka bar can restore it to full energy. Whenever the player loses all lives in the main game, he/she gets a still Game Over screen before being taken back to the first game menu. If the player wants to proceed through the story after losing all lives, he/she must restart on the same level where the player lost. Each level that gets completed is replayable, and they can help the player fulfill the Mini-Games and the Oompa-Loompa Album.
title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius - Jet Fusion

description: As teenaged girl Addie Singer, gamers must face one of life's ultimate challenges--the social ladder of Rocky Road Middle School. The game is based on the characters and events from the Nickelodeon show of the same name.
title: Unfabulous

description:
Only the Dino Thunder Power Rangers can stop the crazy scientist Mesagog from bringing the world back to the time of the dinosaurs. You must use the Dino Zords, potent hybrids of dinosaurs and robots, as one of these heroes to defeat Mesagog and his Tyrannodrones. During missions, you can switch between Zords and use unique power-ups to improve each one's capabilities. More than 50 different tasks and minigames in 10 free-roaming areas will put your talents to the test.

As he battles dangerous dinosaur foes, the player can gather power-ups.
title: Power Rangers: Dino Thunder

alternate_titles.title: Disney La Petite Sirene: Aventure Magique Entre Terre et Mer
Disney's De Kleine Zeemeermin: Magie in Twee Werelden
Disneys Arielle die Meerjungfrau: Ein Meer Voller Abenteuer

title: Disney's The Little Mermaid: Magic in Two Kingdoms

alternate_titles.title: Groove Adventure Rave: Hikari to Yami no Daikessen 2

description: Apotris is a block-stacking game for the Game Boy Advance. It features a large amount of customization so players can tailor the game to their preferences. There are 11 game modes to explore, with various options and challenges. Players can also battle with friends using the Game Boy Advance Link Cable.
title: Apotris

sample_screenshots.caption: Ariel must swim through many magic portals to rescue her merfolk.
Each princess can collect treasures throughout the adventure.
Snow White explores the dwarven mines.
An illustrated introduction precedes each chapter.

description: A 2D platformer with exploration elements based on the Canadian animated series, where Kong has been genetically re-created thanks to a scientist and forms a bond with her grandson, archaeologist and martial arts expert Jason. The game's premise is similar to the cartoon, in which the player must stop the plot of evil professor Ramon and save Kong's native island.
title: Kong: The Animated Series

description: Stuart Little 2 is a 2D explorative platformer which follows the plot from the movie of the same name. Stuart has a new friend, a canary named Margo, and must help her fend off her predator and former master, the Falcon.
title: Stuart Little 2

description:
Licensed on the second Spy Kids film, players enlist at the Organization of Super Spies (OSS) Academy in a series of challenging training exercises. Playing on either normal or expert difficulty, Players get promotions every pre-defined amount of points.

Minigames include side-scrolling platforming, top-down vehicle shooting and behind the player 3D tubing sections.
title: Spy Kids Challenger

description: Kidō Tenshi Angelic Layer is a portable role-playing game based on the Angelic Layer manga, created by the all-female group CLAMP. The title stars a young girl, Misaki Suzuhara, who has just moved to Tokyo and finds herself embroiled in the world of the in-universe game Angelic Layer, which involves physical dolls that fight physical battles on a "layer," controlled mentally by their owners. The game replicates those battles, with the player selecting moves from a list and moving their doll around on a battle grid, attempting to knock their opponent's health down to zero.
title: Kidō Tenshi Angelic Layer

description:
Set in a picturesque and lively town filled with quirky characters and bustling activities, "Pinky Monkey Town" offers a mix of exploration, puzzle-solving, and mini-games. Players take on the role of a curious traveler who arrives in this delightful town, where every corner is brimming with surprises and engaging challenges.

The gameplay revolves around interacting with the diverse monkey inhabitants, each with their own distinct personalities and tasks to offer. Players must navigate through various environments within the town, including bustling marketplaces, serene gardens, lively streets, and mysterious hidden areas. Along the way, they'll encounter puzzles to solve, quests to complete, and mini-games to enjoy, all contributing to the progression of the storyline.

The game's vibrant graphics and lively soundtrack complement the cheerful atmosphere, creating an immersive and charming experience for players of all ages. With its engaging gameplay mechanics and delightful narrative, "Pinky Monkey Town" promises an enjoyable adventure full of laughter, surprises, and heartwarming moments as players explore this enchanting world and uncover its many secrets.
title: Pinky Monkey Town

description:
2 in 1 Game Pack: Spider-Man / Spider-Man 2 features two previously released Marvel-licensed Game Boy Advance Spider-Man titles on a single cartridge. They are:

  • Spider-Man
  • Spider-Man 2

sample_screenshots.caption: Game selection screen for select a game between two of them. Since it's a compilation of two games, the only 'original' screen of this game is this screen.

title: 2 in 1 Game Pack: Spider-Man / Spider-Man 2
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody: Tipton Caper
Cubix: Robots for Everyone - Clash 'n Bash
The Fairly OddParents!: Clash with the Anti-World

description:
Shūto is a teenage boy in a world inhabited by majestic creatures called Wonders. When Shūto's father Genzō gives him a special "Snap Shooter" camera which can turn photographs of Wonders into cards with special powers, Shūto sets off to compete in the Snap Grand Prix, a tournament where players compete with their cards to be crowned the Snap champion. Along the way, Shūto encounters both friends and enemies as well as a conspiracy by an organization called Magnet which captures and exploits Wonders.

Snapkid's is a role-playing/card battle game. Throughout the game, the player explores the world and encounters wild Wonders to take pictures of before using the resulting cards in tournaments against computer-controlled opponents. When encountering a Wonder, the game switches to a first-person camera mode where the player must follow the Wonder with their crosshair in an attempt to take the best possible photograph. Taking a photograph will result in a card being generated, with the abilities of the card varying depending on the distance at which the picture was taken and the species and behavior of the photographed Wonder. In the card battle segments, the player can form a deck of up to 30 cards to use against their opponent. The player wins if the opponent's HP is reduced to 0, or if the deck from which the opponent can draw cards from runs out.
title: Snapkid's

description: Maya the Bee: Sweet Gold is a platforming game and the sequel to Maya the Bee: The Great Adventure, based on the animated TV series. The player navigates either Maya or Willie through 64 stages collecting flowers, dodging foes and uncovering secret rooms along the way. Run, jump, crouch, stomp, fly and interact with objects. It features 3 difficulty settings and progress is automatically saved after each level on cartridge.

sample_screenshots.caption: Where do you want to go?

title: Maya the Bee: Sweet Gold

description: The game centers around Saffron Walnut, who has ambitions to become a fashion designer. The player navigates her around the town to talk to her friends and make progress on her ambition as well as explore the forest in search of the fairies who may be able to help Saffron. At some points in the game, the player can play unlockable mini-games.
title: Sylvanian Families: Fashion Designer ni Naritai! Kurumi Risu no Onnanoko
Matchbox Missions: Air, Land and Sea Rescue / Emergency Response

description: This port of the console game plays differently with the player driving the car across an isometric area following arrow prompts to achieve a number of given objectives (mainly picking up and dropping people) within a set amount of time. Any traffic violations such as going down a one-way street earns penalties. The player is ranked depending on performance. In the adventure mode, the player can play as one of the Olsen twins and can select a type of car, which grows in variety as the player progresses, the ultimate goal being to earn enough money to afford a private beach party to celebrate Sweet 16.
title: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Sweet 16 - Licensed to Drive

description: Math Patrol: The Kleptoid Threat is an edutainment game. Players travel from planet to planet playing various 1st and 2nd grade math focused levels in order to earn money to upgrade your ship and progress towards defeating the Kleptoids who are invading the Milky Way. Gameplay can vary between differently styled shooter levels and quiz-style bonus levels.
title: Math Patrol: The Kleptoid Threat

description: In Silk to Cotton players take the role of Silk or Cotton, ordinary kids until they are transformed into a blob. You must find a way to transform back. By selecting points on the world map you encounter creatures that challenge you to battle or a mini-game. Defeating one will earn you a piece of their body for you to equip to your blobby self. But be careful as you can lose these parts as well. Time passes in real-time and affects where creatures appear on the map.
title: Silk to Cotton

description:
This entry of the W.I.T.C.H. franchise has the five guardians on a rescue mission to liberate Elyon from her brother Phobos in their castle. The guardians are entrusted with magic stones, only to lose them. The heroes travel through portals to acquire those stones, before Phobos himself gets hold of them.

Throughout the game, the player will control one of the guardians. Each guardian must navigate through platforming levels, using unique elemental powers to get past enemies and hazards. At any time, the player can switch to another guardian in order to use different powers for specific encounters. Some levels have unique playable characters. Many levels have their own objectives to complete and gimmicks that make them unique.
title: W.I.T.C.H.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shin Akuma can throw 2 simultaneous fireballs. Take advantage of this!
Mika is crying for her victory
The Hurricane Kick could be a good way to escape from fireballs.
